attributes.action: implement new measures to reduce copper theft in the country.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The use of copper is essential for the functioning of the country, such a telecoms and power. I ask the PM to move on implementing the follow measures to reduce copper theft: 1) Require adequate time between delivery of the copper (and other metals) and payment for authorities to examine, at least on a spot check basis, the transaction. Once the copper or metal is gone the chain of evidence is lost. 2) Require all payments to be made by cheque to a physical address for tracking purposes. 3) Create better and more targeted photo ID of the seller and the delivery vehicle. 4) Require a proper manifest to accompany the copper, when delivered so there is a possible trace, with the copper tagged at the yard until sold. 5) Turn the manifest into a license with a fee attached so additional Police enforcement can be funded. 6) Increase the penalties for these crimes to include damage caused (e.g. £150 worth of copper stolen created £15,000 worth of damages, and then subsequent production loss of an additional £25,000).
